update.description:
This is a PR for only some of the changes from  @PhyNerd's Python 3 PR #21

* Create branch for Python 3 port of ZaberStageController only

    Reverted all files to default except:
    ZaberStageController.py

    This is to allow testing on a per-device basis to allow a practical route to
    actually getting Python 3 changes merged.
update.title: Python3 ZaberStage

content.raw: Closing in favour of the Python-3-only PR #85
content.html: Closing in favour of the Python-3-only PR #85

content.raw: Oh, nice. I’ll look into that.

Given that we only use a few basic commands, we could also just send these directly over serial without a Zaber API, like I have done in my [Raspberry Pi controlled version](#!/monashkrb/labscript_devices/src/RemoteStage/RemoteStage.py).
content.html: Given that we only use a few basic commands, we could also just send these directly over serial without a Zaber API, like I have done in my Raspberry Pi controlled version.

content.raw:
To keep this working for the moment, could we bundle the in-house-python3-ported zaberapi? I checked monash hgweb and do not see any recent commits - could you share your Python3 port Russ?

Then we can port it to use Zaber's newer Python API in the future, but that is different to the goal of Python 3 compatibility with the existing code.

If bundling things, I can move it all to a subfolder in line with the newly allowed layout of labscript_devices.

If we come across any further issues, it is not super worth it to maintain our old copy of the zaberapi and we should port to the new one rather than doing any extensive maintenance.
content.html:
To keep this working for the moment, could we bundle the in-house-python3-ported zaberapi? I checked monash hgweb and do not see any recent commits - could you share your Python3 port Russ?

Then we can port it to use Zaber's newer Python API in the future, but that is different to the goal of Python 3 compatibility with the existing code.

If bundling things, I can move it all to a subfolder in line with the newly allowed layout of labscript_devices.

If we come across any further issues, it is not super worth it to maintain our old copy of the zaberapi and we should port to the new one rather than doing any extensive maintenance.

content.raw:
On Python 3, I get the following error:

```python
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\labscript_suite\labscript_devices\ZaberStageController.py", line 148, in program_manual
    zaberapi.move(self.connection,port,data=values[stage])
  File "C:\labscript_suite\userlib\pythonlib\zaberapi\zaberapi.py", line 75, in move
    connection.write(packet.pack(devnum,movecomm,data))
struct.error: required argument is not an integer
```

Remedied by casting value of data argument to int within `zaberapi.move` \(in `transition_to_buffered` and `program_manual`\). Incidentally, I made the zaberapi \(Monash pythonlib\) Python 3 compatible.
content.html:
On Python 3, I get the following error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\labscript_suite\labscript_devices\ZaberStageController.py", line 148, in program_manual
    zaberapi.move(self.connection,port,data=values[stage])
  File "C:\labscript_suite\userlib\pythonlib\zaberapi\zaberapi.py", line 75, in move
    connection.write(packet.pack(devnum,movecomm,data))
struct.error: required argument is not an integer

Remedied by casting value of data argument to int within zaberapi.move (in transition_to_buffered and program_manual). Incidentally, I made the zaberapi (Monash pythonlib) Python 3 compatible.

content.raw:
Ah I see 'zaberapi' is in monash's pythonlib hg repo. It doesn't look in-house, it looks official, but it doesn't look Python 3 compatible. This must be an older version.

Looks like zaber stage is Python 2 only until we port it to the new zaber API.
content.html:
Ah I see 'zaberapi' is in monash's pythonlib hg repo. It doesn't look in-house, it looks official, but it doesn't look Python 3 compatible. This must be an older version.

Looks like zaber stage is Python 2 only until we port it to the new zaber API.

content.raw:
It looks like the "Zaber Core Serial Library in Python" ([link](https://www.zaber.com/wiki/Software)) provides Python 2 and 3 compatibility in the same spirit as we do - it is accepting of any string type for its send functions, and returns unicode strings from its read functions. So that is ideal.

However, that's not what's being used by the device code. In fact I can't find the 'zaberapi' anywhere on the web - was this perhaps in in-house Monash thing based on the zaber 'legacy Python scripts' ([link](https://www.zaber.com/wiki/Software/Python))?

If so, this device code should be ported to use the new Zaber library, which looks to be good quality.

I've resolved the merge conflicts but I think merging will just result in broken code until this is looked at more closely.
content.html:
It looks like the "Zaber Core Serial Library in Python" (link) provides Python 2 and 3 compatibility in the same spirit as we do - it is accepting of any string type for its send functions, and returns unicode strings from its read functions. So that is ideal.

However, that's not what's being used by the device code. In fact I can't find the 'zaberapi' anywhere on the web - was this perhaps in in-house Monash thing based on the zaber 'legacy Python scripts' (link)?

If so, this device code should be ported to use the new Zaber library, which looks to be good quality.

I've resolved the merge conflicts but I think merging will just result in broken code until this is looked at more closely.

content.raw:
I suspect that will result in broken code since it looks like maybe the zaber api is a wrapper around serial read/write - in which case it will be stringy.

I think we have some of these stages lying around, I might leave this as a pull request until I have a chance to test.

Or at least I'll check out the zaberapi to see what it's doing.
content.html:
I suspect that will result in broken code since it looks like maybe the zaber api is a wrapper around serial read/write - in which case it will be stringy.

I think we have some of these stages lying around, I might leave this as a pull request until I have a chance to test.

Or at least I'll check out the zaberapi to see what it's doing.

content.raw: I don’t think that this device is in use in any of our labs at the moment, so we may as well just resolve the conflicts and merge it?
content.html: I don’t think that this device is in use in any of our labs at the moment, so we may as well just resolve the conflicts and merge it?
